Also only keep a small portion of the zoo running and expand as you go. You can â€œcloseâ€ any facilities in the Zoo management tabs or by clicking on the facility itself. When you close facilities, they wonâ€™t cost any money to run. Make sure to close staff facilities too, not just guest ones. 

And try to hike up entry fees and food/souvenir prices as much as you can. If you add â€œiceâ€ to your products in any of your drink shops (itâ€™s in a condiment drop down menu underneath the product and itâ€™s price) youâ€™ll get an extra $0.10 per transaction. Hmm I donâ€™t want to say CHS (cannabinoid hyperemesis syndrome) because thereâ€™s so little info on it, but anything is worth looking into!

It could also be related to your diet within the past few days or you might be about to start a cold and you donâ€™t realize it yet.

Within your esophagus is the Vagus nerve, which either triggers you to sneeze or it triggers you to throw up. Irritation to it (from coughing, sickness, dehydration, acid reflux) can cause you to just feel nauseous without eating anything bad. Smoking of course irritates it. 

Try drinking some cool water or sucking on peppermint before or after you smoke just to help chill that Vagus nerve out!

Donâ€™t feel guilty! As morbid as it seems, writing down our most personal and sometimes disturbing thoughts is one of the best ways to cope with mental illness.

When we have these thoughts and ideas in our heads, it can be hard to see around them and find solutions, but when you write these suicide notes, you might notice yourself begin to feel more motivated to take care of your problems in a healthy way. (If youâ€™ve ever heard of a Coding Duck, itâ€™s sort of like that but with scary thoughts instead of code)

Youâ€™ve accidentally stumbled upon one of the scientifically-proven ways to save your own life! Itâ€™s not like you ever have to share them with anyone, so donâ€™t hold back and get those suicidal thoughts on paper so they donâ€™t stay in your head. Youâ€™re so strong!

I have a feeling itâ€™d be Winter, which is why I havenâ€™t been confident that sheâ€™ll actually become the Winter Maiden.

Sheâ€™s essentially his right hand, and, discarding his untrustworthy nature, would know all of his plans. Sheâ€™s also shown to have enough authority to command the evacuation procedures of all Atlas academy, as well as command all of Mantle to obey the curfew. Sheâ€™s the perfect candidate AS LONG AS she doesnâ€™t become the maiden. 

Iâ€™ve had a feeling since she told Weiss about her duty as the Maiden, that her â€œperfectâ€ future would crumble around her (as most peopleâ€™s idealized futures do) and her character would become something of a foil to Cinder. They both believe being a Maiden is the key to success, they both believe in â€œdestinyâ€ and hold that destiny with pride. However, unlike Cinder, Winter can probably handle the disappointment if she doesnâ€™t get the Maiden powers. And, in a greater contrast to Cinder, Winter is smart enough and strong enough to move past the failure and come up with a new plan. Preferably one that doesnâ€™t end with her self-sacrifice. 

Itâ€™s just something about how theyâ€™ve portrayed her to be so organized and dutiful. Her perfectionist nature leads me to believe her character will grow emotionally instead of just dying like everyone suspects.
Some folks just swell more and for longer for all sorts of reasons (biology, hormones, immune system, hydration). Your body is just trying REALLY hard to protect you

Not all depression is the same. Youâ€™re not pathetic, buts itâ€™s wrong for you to assume that itâ€™s a cookie cutter illness, or that itâ€™s a competition. Besides, these depressed extroverts are probably using going to parties or hanging out with friends to cope with their mental illness.

And more than that, donâ€™t act like you know anything about those people when all you have is your own perspective.

Heart palpitations are pretty common in most mental illnesses, especially those involving high levels of anxiety. Itâ€™s totally possible youâ€™re depressed and suffering from anxiety at the same time!

I would really recommend seeing a professional about it, as it can be not only draining on your energy but dangerous for your heart. I have severe anxiety, and I have to get EKGs done every so often just because of how fast my heart races all the time. But it can be fixed! I believe you can do it!

Hey, youâ€™ll find new things to look forward to! Iâ€™m 23 now, and I wonâ€™t lie to you, those thoughts never go away.

No medicine, therapy, or coping technique will ever make the thought of wanting to die go away, I promise you. But you can redirect it.

The way I see it for myself is, if I want to die so bad, at least I can die protecting others, or work to death and be remembered as super dedicated to my craft. I think youâ€™re strong enough to find something similar to â€œkill yourselfâ€ with, it just might not exist yet. Keep fighting until you find the thing you truly want to die FOR. I believe in you.

I donâ€™t think youâ€™re broken at all! The fact that you can write this out and identify how you feel, and even identify a coping mechanism (even if itâ€™s not entirely safe) shows that youâ€™re capable and strong!

Heyo, previous anorexic and current IBS patient here.

Let me preface this by saying NOTHING makes me hungry BUT cannabis. Pills and home remedies are completely useless to stimulate my appetite.

But, itâ€™s not realistic or safe for me to wait to eat until my next hit SO hereâ€™s how to eat without actually being hungry:

1. Protein shakes, smoothies, tomato soup, beef broth, etc are NECESSARY.
- youâ€™re going to need to put something in your stomach, wether you want to chew or not. When Iâ€™m in a mood, the thought of even small bits of potato or carrots can make me dry-heave, so nutrient-rich liquids are always on hand. Even just orange juice will help (but if you have Acid reflux too, stick to something less acidic, like milk!(unless youâ€™re lactose intolerant too...))

2. Youâ€™re going to get nauseous. Youâ€™re probably going to throw up, too, be prepared.
-Nausea is a part of life, but it doesnâ€™t always mean you NEED to throw up. Anti-emetics are meds that you can find bit above and below the counter: Emetrol is a liquid one that uses sugar to coat the stomach, Tums uses foam to settle acid-related discomfort, and Omeprazol is a minor psychoactive that stops your brain from making you nauseous. Choose one that best relieves the source of your nausea, wether it be physical or anxiety-based.
-you WILL vomit. Sorry, but itâ€™s not the end of the world! Keep some toothpaste, a toothbrush, and some non-flavored gum on hand, and, if youâ€™re able, a change of clothes! You NEED to brush your teeth after you vomit, or else youâ€™ll destroy your teeth overtime with stomach acid. Plus, the taste of vomit just makes you want to throw up more, right? The non-flavored gum helps distract, but it also stimulates saliva production which will help soothe the inside of your mouth and throat.

3. Eat at the same time everyday.
-even if youâ€™re just shoving a cracker or piece of chocolate in your mouth, try and schedule your feeding times. The brain thrives on pattern and routine; youâ€™ve heard of Pavlovâ€™s dog right? Even if youâ€™re not hungry at these feeding times, your body will still be accustomed to digesting at the same time everyday (it learns SUPER quickly) and it will help lesson the pain of digestion and maybe even solidify your Hershey Squirts. 

I hope the rest of you break is as liquid smooth as your dumps. Please eat something, or youâ€™ll only ruin your stomach more like I did ğŸ˜¬

Iâ€™m new so I donâ€™t think I have much to offer, but I recently ran into the same problem.

My solution was to instead make a supporting character EXACTLY like me. Instead of imagining myself in the heroics of the main character, Iâ€™ve been exploring how I would act if my best friend suddenly became a hero, or how I would react if someone came to me with a dark secret. Itâ€™s been very helpful, as I have to purposefully reign in this characterâ€™s motives and actions. 

Itâ€™s also been helpful in a humbling, introspective way. This character doesnâ€™t have to save the world, so what are your flaws that would stop them from doing so? Are they scared or selfish? Do they have what it takes from your own personality to be a hero- and that brings the question, could you really ever be a hero?

Itâ€™s been very fun!
